From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>

Hello Stephanie,

It looks like a web page has to execute some javascript i=
n order to
determine the screen resolution. There is no way to do that with=
in
heritrix.

However, that shouldn't necessarily be an impediment to succe=
ssful
capture and replay. For example,
http://web.archive.org/web/201404041=
55044/http://www.whatismyscreenresolution.com/
works for me. The solution t=
o the problem you're facing, if any, will
depend on other technical details=
 of what's happening.

Noah


On Mon, May 26, 2014 at 5:20 AM, Steph sherlo=
ck.h221b@...
[archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com> wrot=
e:
>
>
> Dear all,
>
> The website I want to crawl detects the resolution u=
sing JavaScript and only
> grants access if you use a specific resolution. =
So I always end up with the
> error message saying I must change my screen =
resolution.
>

on when crawling?
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Stephanie
